ygData.subject: Fear
ygData.msgSnippet: Eyes wide with fear, Teltoli brought her hands up so she could try and pry the hand that was gripping her throat. The Fuzor made a strangled sound in the back

Subject: Fear
Message-ID: <96vuq7+cj0r@...>

User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: steph_teltoli@...

Eyes wide with fear, Teltoli brought her hands up so she could try 
and pry the hand that was gripping her throat. The Fuzor made a 
strangled sound in the back of her throat, and when Carnage let go, 
so she scrambled backwards, getting as far away as possible. Or, 
until her back hit a tree trunk.

"Gods! I was only joking!" She protested, her voice now slightly 
hoarse. She winced and rubbed her throat. Sheesh. "Okay, Okay, I'll 
go get the damn boulder.."

Teltoli stood up rather quickly, and took another glance at Carnage, 
thinking this had to be part of the training. Thinking back to the 
words that Carnage had said when she was lucky she wasn't some Pred 
Commander, but a friend. "Some friend.." She muttered quietly to 
herself, so nobody else would hear. She felt strangely.. betrayed. 

Setting off into the air again, she was pleased to have some time to 
think and be alone while she flew. Gosh, if Carnage was going to be 
that rough, maybe she shouldn't have.. no! She was going to stick 
through the training, and she wasn't going to be a whinging brat! If 
she wasn't to question orders, then she wouldn't question them. 

"SilverWing's may be damn stubborn, but they always get the job 
done!", That's what her Father had always said, and she was going to 
follow that little gem of advice.

After giving herself a mental sort out, she powered towards the swamp 
again.

'Now, to find another boulder!' She thought to herself, and used her 
scanners to find one. After a half minute, she was rather 
dissapointed she could find one the proper size. Looking towards the 
bog, she scanned in there.. and found one! Completely submerged, but 
it seemed the right size, and was the perfect shape. Teltoli smiled, 
and hunted out some vines again. 

Keeping her scanners on, she took a deep breath and walked into the 
bog, sumberging and closing her eyes. Her scanners told her where 
everything was without the benefit of eyesight. Managing to tie one 
vine around it, she swam back up to the top and broke the surface, 
taking a deep lungful of air before going under and tieing two more 
vines. This repeated several times before she had seven vines wrapped 
around it, and a nice loop at the end so she could carry it.

Teltoli climbed out of the bog, noticing with slight disgust that she 
was covered with bog gunk. But she hauled the boulder out, knowing 
slightly more of what she was doing. The Fuzor grinned with 
satisfaction and began hauling it towards the swamp again.

This time when she emerged from the trees, she had a slightly guilty 
look on her face, as if whether deciding to apologize or just keep it 
to herself..
